the structure of a poetical composition.
of, characteristic of, like or fit for poetry; poetical.
that which mars the structure, beauty of a poem or poetical work; a poetical fault.
a removal of poetical faults.
the main theme of poetry in gen. or of a poetical work.
a person skilled in poetics.
the part of literary criticism that deals with poetry; the branch of knowledge that deals with the techniques of poetry; poetics.
a man having a taste for, and can appreciate the beauty of, poetical compositions.
the poetical standard of a literary work.
(rhet.) a figure of seech in which a thing though impracticable or improbable, is justified by a simile or a plausible reason.
the subject matter of a literary work.
the recitation of a poem.
= ಕಾವ್ಯಜ್ಞ.
= ಕಾವ್ಯಜ್ಞೆ.
(rhet.) poetical idioms, esp. imiaginary ones, used to embelish poetical works; a poetical convention.
deep involvement in reading and perfect absorption in the subject of a literary work.
